body_html:
No, I didn't want to throw out useful optimization, sorry if it sounded like that. I had understood that there was a general move from TH(CU)NN to ATen/native.
One thing I noticed is that the accumulation kernel in ATen/native/cpu doesn't differentiate between "data touching accumulation" and "further accumulation of intermediates", but that would be useful for an optimized variance. (I do believe that calculating mean and variance in a joint kernel would probably be a good idea for further optimization, too, but that is probably just me.)

No, I didn't want to throw out useful optimization, sorry if it sounded like that. I had understood that there was a general move from TH(CU)NN to ATen/native.
One thing I noticed is that the accumulation kernel in ATen/native/cpu doesn't differentiate between "data touching accumulation" and "further accumulation of intermediates", but that would be useful for an optimized variance. (I do believe that calculating mean and variance in a joint kernel would probably be a good idea for further optimization, too, but that is probably just me.)
